p: In addition, the C.cit essential oil had a fungicidal effect against S. cucurbitacearum from 900 Âµg/mL. Indeed, for A. alternata, C.cit had fungistatic effects at 0.6 mg/mL and 0.7 mg/mL, and it was fungicidal from 0.8 mg/mL ( Table 4). These data show that the C.cit had potent antifungal activity against A. alternata and S. cucurbitacearum with IC 50 values of 0.315 mg/mL and 0.102 mg/mL, respectively ( Figure 3). The essential oils of L.dent, L.hyb, M.alt, O.maj1, and O.maj2 showed moderate antifungal activities against A. alternata, with IC 50 values from 0.473 mg/mL to 0.893 mg/mL, as similarly against S. cucurbitacearum, with IC 50 values from 0.322 mg/mL to 0.884 mg/mL. However, L.nob showed only weak antifungal activities against both A. alternata and S. cucurbitacearum, as seen by its relatively high IC 50 values of 1.310 mg/mL and 1.248 mg/mL, respectively ( Figure 3).
